page.title: 03Marldon. Village Clubs.
page.content: Marldon has many organisations. The{sporting}ones are cricket club, football and tennis clubs. The{football}club is called Marldon Spurs and plays on a field above Hills Quarry. The field is used as pasture land during the rest of the week. The team plays in local leagues. The{cricket}club has been going for two years. Matches are held in the Meadow,by the Church House Inn. Mr.Parry is the captain. The club has made a cricket square and put up a fence to protect the Council Houses. The{tennis}club has started in the hope that tennis courts will be built in Marldon. At present members play on courts in holiday camps out of our map area. Most sports people go out of the area to Paignton or Torquay to play.
